name: Death to Spies
description: Smersh is Russian for "Death to Spies" and was the name of a set of counterintelligence agencies formed in the Soviet Army during World War II. Their mission was to secure the rear of the active Red Army by arresting traitors, deserters, spies and criminal cells.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Windows® 2000/XP/Vista/7/8/8.1/10 Processor: Intel Pentium 4 1.7 GHz or AMD Athlon 1.8 GHz (Intel Pentium 4 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon 2.4 GHz+ or higher recommended) Memory: 512 MB RAM (1 GB RAM recommended) Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 5200/ATI Radeon 9500 with 128 MB RAM or higher(NVIDIA GeForce 6800/ATI Radeon X800 with 256 MB RAM or higher recommended)* DirectX Version: DirectX® version 9.0 (included) or higher Sound: DirectX® version 9.0-compatible sound card Hard Drive: 3 GB free space* Indicates device should be compatible with DirectX® version 9.0 or higher.

reviews.review_text: This is a third person stealth shooter, where you play as a Soviet spy during the second world war. The graphics of the game are a bit outdated, and the AI isn't the best, but the storyline and the rather difficult gameplay make up for it. I'd definitely reccomend this game if you like stealth games. However, the game is extremely difficult, so be prepared to spend a long time planning how to solve a level.

In Soviet Russia, Man-Hit you! This is basically WWII Hitman with GLORIOUS MOTHER RUSSIA as your employer. Plot is irrelevant since it's more than likely the kind of WWII 'intrigue' story you've heard, seen, and had forced down your throat umpteen times. But really you'll be hard pressed to find a bigger bang for your buck on Steam. The levels are very large and give you lots of options to complete missions within the parameters you need to work with. Nice to play a game that understands how experimentation and problem solving make for a good stealth game, not just being able to set up several 'silent takedowns' with click of a button.

Just like hitman but instead of the modern time its the WWII time!! You work for a russian agency that normally arrests traitors, deserters, spies and criminal cells but instead of arresting them you must eliminate them. Driveable cars, trucks, and bikes. Ai are really tough. Always in a german base with lieteralyl 60+ enemys. You can take out your targets the loud way or you can kill them in a silent way   If your a steath person and enjoyed the hitman series, than this is the series for you!
Similar to Hitman, although not as good as Contracts or Blood Money. Can be very difficult at times but is worth playing.
Had a lot of fun with this game. Highly recommend.

Plays basically like Hitman with a bit of Commandos. It's pretty difficult and unpolished, so I'd just recommend it for more hardcore stealth fans who can look over a relatively steep learning curve (I didn't have much trouble, but many other people seem to) and an overall lack of polish. If you can get over that, Death to Spies is a really fun game. I especially like the overall atmosphere. My only complaints are that it's relatively short (especially Moment of Truth) and that missions don't seem to have as much replayability as in Hitman. The story is also pretty weak and confusing, but I never cared for that in Hitman either.

Very interesting and intense game at times. I personally like stealth and espionage games therefore this game fell right into my domain.  Mission design is pretty good and allows for a variety of approaches. Voice acting is a bit off in the intro scenes of each mission in terms of quality. It is not carried out throughout missions which is a good thing.  Dynamics are added that will not allow you to wear an enemy's outfit if you put a bullet through it however sometimes it glitches out and won't let you change costumes even with headshots (I tested this out since I saved before trying to obtain an officer's outfit and I was able to get it in my 4th or 5th attempt).  Physics seem good and the graphics are not bad for a game that was created in 2007. The graphics are pretty good actually.  The AI is okay as well; not dumb but not super alert as well (this may differ on your difficulty settings).  The retail price of $4.99 seems to be quite a good price for this game. I got Death to Spies: Moment of Truth but I have yet to play and possibly review that game too so I cannot say if $12.99 is worth the two games or not; if it does go on a sale the 2 game bundle may be worth it.  Rating - 8.2/10
Both of the Death to Spies games are under rated gems that desserve much more attention and praise. It's like a WWII hitman game. What's not to love?

Commandos meets Hitman. Just like Commandos it's almost a puzzle game, working out which guards to take out in which order. Great game if you have the patience - just remember to enable the map overlay which shows enemy fields of view.  There are a couple of must-have mods floating around the internet. One restores cut historical symbols, the other replaces the bad American voice acting with the original Russian, with English subtitles. Atmosphere is improved ten-fold.

Soviet Union, 1951. After the arrest of Viktor Abakumov, head of SMERSH a counterintelligence agency, Major Semion Strogov is interrogated about his missions under SMERSH.  You play as the major in 10 missions during WWII, your missions will consist of kidnaping, sabotage, assasination, rescue, and intelligence gathering. Some examples are: Infiltration in Los Alamos Lab to gather intelligence about the nuclear project of US, and the assassination of Nazi officers in an Abwehr Intelligence School in Krakow.  A very interesting game, the interface may be a llitle clunky but you will get used to it, many people say that this game is hard, so I recommend to play on easy and use guides. I think you will find this game very satisfying even if you are not a fan of stealth games.  There is no much story in the game, the goal and end of the interrogation of Strogov is not revealed in this game and I am not soure if this is concluded in the sequel. In any case the missions are interesting by themselves so I recommend this game.

Game was first unplayable due to camera and motion control issues. Enabling Tripple Buffering and Vsync in SmershSetup.exe in the installation folder, cleared all these issues, and the game works great!

Feels like a mix of Hitman 2016 with Splinter Cell Chaos Theory's interactive menu and aesthetically like Metal Gear Solid 3, and it does it damn well. You manage your mission loadout with a weight and item slot limit forcing you to carefully decide what you need without being too punishing. You can scrape through a mission any way you need to. The challenge is nice without being impossible, and you can salvage a situation as quickly as you can screw it up. One weird thing about this game is that it doesn't recognize MMB as an input. not too big a deal since there aren't so many controls that you'll be all over your keyboard.
I nominated this for the 'Best Worst Game' award write-in category. It's probably a fine game, but I can't get over how goofy you can make it, like in Jerma's video.
